topics.title: Capture Purchase Price on Add
topics.goal: Allow admins to enter and persist a purchase price when creating a book record.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An authenticated admin opens the Add Book form.
topics.when: They enter a numeric purchase price and submit the form.
topics.then: The value is validated (required, non-negative) and written to Firestore with the new book.
topics.notes: Includes schema update, client-side validation messaging, and serverTimestamp-safe writes.

topics.title: Edit Stored Purchase Price
topics.goal: Enable admins to adjust the saved purchase price on existing books without recreating them.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A book exists in inventory with or without a purchase price set.
topics.when: An admin invokes the edit action and updates the purchase price field.
topics.then: The new value passes validation and updates the Firestore document, reflecting immediately in the UI.
topics.notes: Guard against empty submissions; reuse validation logic from TP1; keep optimistic UI updates consistent.

topics.title: Admin Visibility of Purchase Price
topics.goal: Surface each book's purchase price to admins within list/detail panels for quick reference.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin loads the inventory dashboard or detail drawer.
topics.when: Books are rendered in the admin UI.
topics.then: Each entry shows the stored purchase price (formatted currency or placeholder when missing) without affecting actions.
topics.notes: Ensure formatting is locale-aware and accessible; no exposure in public components.

topics.title: Hide Purchase Price from Public Catalog
topics.goal: Guarantee purchase price data never appears in the public catalog payloads or UI.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A visitor browses the public catalog.
topics.when: Client-side code queries Firestore and renders cards.
topics.then: Purchase price fields are omitted or stripped before rendering so no cost data leaks publicly.
topics.notes: Double-check Firestore queries/selects and DOM templates; consider security rules to block reads from non-admin contexts.

features.description: Introduce a supplier master so admins can CRUD suppliers (Name, Location) and keep every book attached to a supplier.

topics.title: Create Supplier Records
topics.goal: Allow admins to add supplier entries with required name and location data.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the Supplier Master view.
topics.when: They submit the form with a supplier name and location.
topics.then: A new supplier document is persisted and listed without duplicates.
topics.notes: Surface inline validation for required fields and prevent duplicate supplier names.

topics.title: Edit or Remove Supplier Records
topics.goal: Let admins update supplier details or remove suppliers that are no longer in use.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A supplier exists in the master list.
topics.when: An admin edits the name/location or requests deletion.
topics.then: Changes persist with audit safety, and deletions are blocked if books still reference the supplier.
topics.notes: Show dependency warnings for in-use suppliers and ensure local lists stay in sync after edits.

topics.title: Attach Supplier on Book Creation
topics.goal: Require selecting an existing supplier whenever a new book is created.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin is creating a book and the supplier master already contains at least one active supplier.
topics.when: They select a supplier from the dropdown (or attempt to submit without a selection) and submit the book form.
topics.then: Valid submissions persist the supplier reference with the book, while missing/invalid selections block the save with clear feedback.
topics.notes: Sync the supplier list in real time, prevent stale selections when a supplier is deleted mid-session, and support keyboard navigation for the control.

topics.title: Edit Book-Supplier Mapping
topics.goal: Enable admins to change the supplier linked to an existing book.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A book already has a supplier association.
topics.when: An admin selects a different supplier and confirms the edit.
topics.then: The book document updates with the new supplier, and all admin views refresh to reflect the change.
topics.notes: Prevent orphan mappings by validating the new supplier still exists; broadcast updates to caching layers if any.

features.description: Capture the complete sale outcome for each book, including sale price, inventory status, partner payout shares, and buyer attribution.

topics.title: Record Sale Status and Price
topics.goal: Let admins toggle in-stock vs sold-out and capture the final sale price in a single action.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A book exists in the catalog and is ready to be marked as sold.
topics.when: The admin switches the sale status and enters a sale price before saving.
topics.then: The book document stores the status flag plus a validated sale price (required when sold, optional when still in stock).
topics.notes: Enforce positive currency values, prevent marking as sold without a price, and update stock counters in the UI after persistence.

topics.title: Compute Revenue Shares
topics.goal: Automatically calculate Srikar's share and the supplier share using sale and cost prices.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The book already stores a cost price and the sale workflow captured a sale price.
topics.when: The admin confirms the sale.
topics.then: Srikar's share is recorded as (sale price - cost price)/2 and supplier share as cost price + (sale price - cost price)/2 with consistent rounding rules.
topics.notes: Guard against sale prices lower than cost, surface computed amounts before commit, and reuse currency-format helpers to keep reports consistent.

topics.title: Associate Buyer With Sale
topics.goal: Link each sold book to a buyer drawn from the customer master so downstream reports know who purchased it.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: Customer records exist and a book is being marked as sold.
topics.when: The admin searches for and selects a buyer (or adds one on the fly) within the sale confirmation flow.
topics.then: The sale record stores the buyer reference and displays it anywhere the sale appears (history, settlements, receipts).
topics.notes: Selection should be mandatory for sold books, support search by name/WhatsApp, and prevent orphaned references if the customer later changes.

features.description: Introduce a lightweight customer directory with add/edit flows that capture name, address, location, and WhatsApp number for reuse in sales.

topics.title: Add Customer Records
topics.goal: Allow admins to create customers with the required contact fields so that buyers can be tracked.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the Customer Master module.
topics.when: They submit the add form with name, address, location, and WhatsApp number.
topics.then: A validated customer document is stored with normalized phone data and timestamps.
topics.notes: Deduplicate by name + WhatsApp, enforce number formatting, and show inline errors for missing required fields.

topics.title: Edit Customer Records
topics.goal: Let admins update customer details without breaking links to past sales.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A customer already exists in the directory.
topics.when: An admin opens the record and amends the address, location, or WhatsApp info.
topics.then: Changes persist, update the modified timestamp, and propagate to any sale views that reference the customer.
topics.notes: Prevent edits that clear required fields, highlight unsaved changes, and keep references stable via immutable IDs.

topics.title: Customer Lookup for Sales
topics.goal: Expose a searchable customer list so other workflows (like sales settlement) can pick buyers quickly.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the customer lookup without any filter applied.
topics.when: They enter a search term (e.g., name or WhatsApp) and submit/filter.
topics.then: Until text is entered the list stays empty with guidance; once a query is provided, only matching customer summaries (name, location, WhatsApp) appear and the selected customer ID is emitted back to the calling workflow.
topics.notes: Keep the pre-search state blank with helper text, require at least a few characters before querying, provide debounced search, highlight exact matches, and coordinate with F06-TP3 so a single selection UI can serve multiple modules.

features.description: Enable admins to record multi-item sales with customer attribution, per-book pricing, and consistent inventory status labels.

topics.title: Capture Sale Header
topics.goal: Require selecting a customer and sale date before adding sold books.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the Add Sale workflow and customer records already exist.
topics.when: They search for a buyer and choose a sale date prior to saving.
topics.then: The sale form locks in the selected customer ID and sale date, blocking continuation until both values pass validation.
topics.notes: Surface inline errors for missing selections, support calendar pickers plus manual entry, and store timestamps in UTC.

topics.title: Add Sale Line Items
topics.goal: Allow admins to add one line per book sold, capturing title, supplier, and selling price.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The sale header is valid and the catalog already tracks purchase prices, suppliers, and stock.
topics.when: The admin searches for a book, selects it (possibly multiple times for separate quantities), and enters a selling price for each line.
topics.then: Each line stores the book reference, supplier snapshot, and validated selling price while allowing duplicate book entries to represent multiple quantities.
topics.notes: Prevent mixing draft lines with missing prices, auto-populate supplier info when a book is chosen, and show running totals.

topics.title: Persist Sale and Align UI Copy
topics.goal: Save the sale record and ensure the legacy 'Mark as Sold' button now reads 'Out of stock'.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: All sale header and line item validations pass.
topics.when: The admin submits the sale.
topics.then: A sale document containing the header and all line items is persisted, and every instance of the old 'Mark as Sold' button label is updated to 'Out of stock' without changing inventory automatically.
topics.notes: Delay automatic stock flips until inventory rules mature; still show per-line persistence status and keep the new label consistent across the admin UI.

features.description: Streamline sale line creation by letting admins search by book title, auto-fill supplier/price context, and manage the draft row without extra inventory lookups.

topics.title: Title Autocomplete Experience
topics.goal: Make the sale line title picker visually rich with card-style suggestions, keyboard navigation, and clear post-selection feedback.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin is adding a sale line and catalog titles exist.
topics.when: They type into the Book title field and move through the suggestion list via mouse or keyboard.
topics.then: Each suggestion renders as a clickable card showing title, author, supplier badges, and a caret; hover/focus states highlight the option, the active item exposes aria-selected="true", selecting a book shows a confirmation chip under #saleLineBookSummary, clears the list with a “Book selected” toast near #saleLineMsg, moves focus to the selling-price field, and no-match scenarios keep the line disabled with the guidance message.
topics.notes: Use the title-only search, add solid backgrounds plus outline for the focused item, support ESC to dismiss, and announce the number of matches for assistive tech.

topics.title: Header CTA and Draft Flow Alignment
topics.goal: Rename the header CTA, gate book entry until customer/date validate, and keep the draft row messaging in sync with the current selection.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The sale header form is visible inside the sale entry experience.
topics.when: The admin interacts with the header (selecting customer/date, pressing the CTA) or selects a book for the draft line.
topics.then: The primary CTA reads “Add books” (beside a disabled Persist sale button) with helper text “Customer + date unlocks book entry,” stays disabled until both fields validate, and on success silently resets the form without extra banners; the draft label stays “Add another book,” while focus hops to the price field after a selection and returns to the book input once the line saves.
topics.notes: Keep helper copy inline beneath the CTA, briefly show a success state on the CTA before re-enabling, and ensure keyboard users perceive the label changes.

topics.title: Customer Selection Feedback
topics.goal: Provide visible confirmation when a buyer is selected from the lookup list and mirror the state in the summary pill.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin is choosing a customer via the lookup list inside the sale header.
topics.when: They click Select on a customer and the hidden ID updates successfully.
topics.then: The chosen row highlights with a filled background and the Select button becomes a checkmark chip labeled “Selected,” while #saleHeaderCustomerSummary swaps in the customer name, WhatsApp, city, and a “Change customer” text button that animates into view.
topics.notes: Keep the state persistent after closing the lookup, announce the selection change for assistive tech, and allow re-selecting another customer which clears the prior highlight.

topics.title: Persistent Customer Selection
topics.goal: Ensure a chosen customer remains selected even if the lookup input is cleared, only changing when a new customer is picked.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin has successfully selected a customer and sees the summary pill populated.
topics.when: They clear the lookup search field or type a new string without confirming another customer.
topics.then: The previously selected customer stays locked in (highlight + summary pill intact) until another customer is explicitly selected, with an optional clear-selection control to reset the state.
topics.notes: Debounce search input reset so it never wipes the stored selection, show a subtle notice that a customer is already selected, and require an explicit 'Change customer' action before replacing the selection.

topics.title: Sale Panel Access and Visual Hierarchy
topics.goal: Add a primary Record sale entry point and restyle the sale panel with elevated inputs, sticky sections, and informative empty states.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An authenticated admin is on admin.html with the inventory header (search + actions) visible.
topics.when: They click the Record sale button beside the search box.
topics.then: The button (matching other primary actions) scroll-focuses or opens the sale panel/modal, #saleEntryPanel inputs use a raised token with lighter background plus outline/glow focus states, sticky section headers keep the sale header and line form separated, and concise empty-state hints clarify what totals or metadata will appear after books are added.
topics.notes: Ensure the Record sale action is one tap away on desktop/mobile, trap focus inside the modal when open, keep the panel visible by default for keyboard access, and provide the “Customer + date unlocks book entry” reminder near the CTA.

topics.title: Clear Lookup After Selection
topics.goal: Automatically reset the customer search field and collapse results after a customer is selected.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A customer selection succeeds and the summary pill shows the chosen buyer.
topics.when: The selection confirmation event fires (button press or keyboard action).
topics.then: The lookup input clears its text, the autocomplete results list disappears, focus shifts to the next logical control (e.g., sale date), and the previously selected customer remains locked in until Change customer is invoked.
topics.notes: Announce the reset for assistive tech, prevent accidental clearing if selection fails, and re-open the search automatically when Change customer is pressed.

topics.title: Selling Price Input Guardrails
topics.goal: Restrict the selling price field to numeric entry with immediate validation feedback.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin is entering a selling price for a sale line.
topics.when: They type characters into the selling price input or attempt to submit a non-numeric/negative value.
topics.then: Only digits (and a single optional decimal separator) are accepted, invalid keystrokes are ignored, and inline validation explains that the selling price must be a positive number before the line can be saved.
topics.notes: Reuse existing currency-validation helpers, keep keyboard navigation (Tab, Backspace) functional, and announce validation errors to assistive tech users.

features.description: Keep the admin inventory search responsive by surfacing the Available panel results whenever a query is entered.

topics.title: Header Search Filters Available Panel
topics.goal: Embed the title/author search inside the Available accordion header so admins filter Available results in place with accessible feedback.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An authenticated admin is on admin.html and sees the Available accordion summary row containing the Search by title or author field.
topics.when: They enter at least two characters into the header search (or edit the query) while the Available list is on the page.
topics.then: The Available accordion keeps its current open/closed state, filters the list in place, and announces the filtered results via aria-live messaging scoped to the panel without forcing focus or scrolling.
topics.notes: The search input, label, and aria-live node move inside the Available summary/header (e.g., `#availableSearchInput`, `#availableSearchLabel`, `#availableSearchStatus`). Keep the <2 character guard scoped to this header search, tie the label/aria-controls to the Available panel, ensure the field is keyboard accessible, and drop the prior debounce, auto-scroll, and reduced-motion behaviors.

features.description: Let admins remove mistakenly added books from the Record sale accordion before persisting an order, mirroring common cart/order editing patterns.

topics.title: Expose Remove Controls Per Line
topics.goal: Surface an accessible remove affordance on every sale line row so admins can initiate deletion like they would in commerce order tables.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The Record sale table already lists at least one book line and the sale header is marked ready.
topics.when: An admin focuses, hovers, or activates the delete control for a specific line (mouse, keyboard, or touch).
topics.then: Each row reveals a trash icon + text button with an aria-label naming the book, uses the same hit target width across desktop/mobile, and triggers a confirmation pattern (inline dialog or two-step button) before removal proceeds.
topics.notes: Keep controls visible on focus (not hover-only), announce pending removal via aria-live, and prevent the delete control while the header is locked.

topics.title: Remove Line and Recalculate Draft State
topics.goal: When removal is confirmed, delete the line from local state, update totals, and reset the draft inputs so another book can be added immediately.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A sale draft contains one or more line items and the admin confirms a removal event for a particular line.
topics.when: The removal confirmation completes.
topics.then: The line disappears from the table, totals and amount chips recompute, the supplier snapshot/book summary clear if that book was active, focus returns to the book input, and removing the final line resets the draft label plus disables Persist sale until a new line is added.
topics.notes: Log the change in the inline status list, reuse the existing draft reset helper, and ensure undo/redo shortcuts do not re-add the line accidentally.

topics.title: Persist Clean Payload After Removals
topics.goal: Guarantee that Persist sale only sends the currently visible lines and blocks submission if all lines were deleted.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: One or more lines have been removed (possibly leaving zero lines) and the admin proceeds to Persist sale.
topics.when: The Persist sale action runs validation and prepares the Firestore payload.
topics.then: Only remaining lines are serialized, removed entries never reach Firestore, Persist sale is disabled with guidance when no lines remain, and the success toast/status list mentions how many line items were ultimately saved.
topics.notes: Audit logs should note removed line IDs when available, and integration tests should assert the payload omits deleted lines even if their book IDs still exist in autocomplete history.

features.description: Enable admins to create supplier-scoped bundles, control publish status, and search bundles by included book titles.

topics.title: Create Supplier-Scoped Bundles
topics.goal: Allow admins to create Draft bundles by locking a supplier, selecting two or more of that supplier's books, and capturing a rupee price with a default 25% discount.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The admin opens the Create Bundle panel and the supplier master already contains valid entries.
topics.when: They choose a supplier (which locks until Reset), use the sale-style autocomplete to add two unique books from that supplier, and accept or override the recommended price within the allowed 1..total range.
topics.then: Submit persists a Draft bundle document containing supplier metadata, ordered bookIds/books, totalListPriceRupees, recommendedPriceRupees, bundlePriceRupees, and createdBy timestamps; validation blocks duplicate books or out-of-range pricing.
topics.notes: Bundle content stays immutable post-save; price defaults to 25% off combined book price (whole rupees).

topics.title: Publish or Unpublish Bundles
topics.goal: Give admins controls to publish/unpublish a bundle while preventing edits to title, books, or price after creation.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A Draft or Published bundle is loaded into the status panel.
topics.when: The admin clicks Publish or Unpublish and (optionally) attempts to edit immutable fields.
topics.then: Only the status field transitions between Draft and Published, immutable fields snap back with explanatory messaging, and Firestore receives the status update without mutating title/books/price.
topics.notes: Expose clear status chips + disabled inputs and reuse centralized status helper for consistency.

topics.title: List Bundles + Search by Book
topics.goal: Provide a bundles list that can be filtered via book autocomplete selection plus supplier/status dropdowns, while surfacing publish controls per row.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: Bundles exist in Firestore and the admin opens the Existing Bundles panel.
topics.when: They type at least two characters into the bundle search autocomplete, select a book suggestion (optionally narrow by supplier or status), or reset the selection.
topics.then: The list immediately shows only bundles whose stored books include the selected book ID, combines any supplier/status filters, displays title/supplier/price/book-count/status plus publish/unpublish buttons, and shows an empty-state message when no bundles match; clearing the selection returns to an unfiltered view.
topics.notes: Must reuse the stable book search helper, require explicit selection (not free-text), and ensure legacy bundles missing embedded book objects are hydrated before filtering.

features.description: Enforce mandatory price fields for books and bundles so catalog data stays trustworthy and downstream calculations have complete inputs.

topics.title: Require Book Price, MRP, and Purchase Price
topics.goal: Ensure the Add Book workflow treats selling price, MRP, and purchase price as required numeric fields before a book can be saved.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens the Add Book form and fills out book metadata.
topics.when: They attempt to save without entering valid values for price, MRP, or purchase price.
topics.then: Inline validation blocks submission, highlights each missing or invalid field, and only proceeds once all three price fields contain non-negative integers; successful submissions persist the trio alongside the book.
topics.notes: Update client validation, Firestore writes, and admin UI so price, MRP, and purchase price are mandatory and surfaced wherever books appear.

topics.title: Bundle Price Must Be Entered
topics.goal: Prevent bundle creation unless the bundle price input contains a valid rupee value within the 1..sum range.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin locks a supplier, selects qualifying books, and reaches the bundle price step.
topics.when: They leave the bundle price empty or clear it after the recommended value appears.
topics.then: Submit stays disabled, inline messaging explains that bundle price is mandatory, and the persisted document always includes bundlePriceRupees.
topics.notes: Covers UI messaging, validation, and payload enforcement so bundle price cannot be omitted even if a recommendation is shown.

features.description: Split the oversized admin accordion into smaller task pages with icon-driven navigation and keep Add Book as the default landing view.

topics.title: Add Book Default Landing
topics.goal: Ensure the Add Book workflow loads first (and via direct link) so the highest-frequency task is instantly available after sign-in.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An authenticated admin completes the sign-in flow or opens the /admin route without a section specified.
topics.when: The workspace initializes or the admin refreshes the page.
topics.then: The Add Book page renders as the default view with its icon tile marked active, collapsible sections hidden elsewhere, and deep links (hash/URL param) that always land on Add Book.
topics.notes: Keep form autofill helpers intact, surface a clear heading for screen readers, and make the nav state reflect that Add Book is the default selection.

topics.title: Expandable Icon Menu Navigation
topics.goal: Convert the existing icon grid into an accessible navigation hub where each tile expands to reveal description and sub-actions before routing to its page.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin is in the signed-in workspace and sees the icon-style menu bar.
topics.when: They focus or click a tile (Manage books, Bundles, Suppliers, etc.).
topics.then: The tile expands to show its summary and CTA links, other tiles collapse, ARIA attributes update (role=tab/accordion) for screen readers, and selecting a CTA routes to the corresponding page.
topics.notes: Tiles must be reachable via keyboard, remember expanded/collapsed state, and expose data-nav hooks codex-dev can bind to new pages.

topics.title: Dedicated Admin Task Pages
topics.goal: Move each major accordion panel (bundles, sale recording, requests, suppliers) into its own lightweight page/screen loaded via the icon menu.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin activates a nav tile other than Add Book (e.g., Bundles).
topics.when: Navigation loads the selected task page via routing or dynamic content swap.
topics.then: Only that task's content is rendered (with its own hero/actions), the menu highlights the active tile, and back/overview links allow returning to the menu without scrolling a mega-accordion.
topics.notes: Each page should lazy-load only the scripts/data needed for that task and preserve existing forms/validation while removing redundant accordion chrome.

features.description: Ensure every major admin accordion/panel (including Customer Master) and its key workflows have a clear navigation or deep-link entry from admin.html.

topics.title: Unified Admin Nav Map
topics.goal: Render the admin navigation from a single config so every major panel (Manage books, Bundles, Record sale, Book requests, Suppliers, Customer master) has a visible entry point tied to its DOM id.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An authenticated admin visits /admin and the workspace markup loads.
topics.when: The navigation bar initializes.
topics.then: Buttons for each major panel are generated with consistent data-nav ids, aria-controls pointing at the correct accordion/panel element, and keyboard focus order that lets users jump to any workflow without scrolling.
topics.notes: Expose the nav map for reuse by deep-link helpers and tests so coverage stays in sync when panels are added or renamed.

topics.title: Customer Master Entry (Mouse-First)
topics.goal: Add a Customers nav control so mouse users can open the Customer Master accordion from the menu without scrolling.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The Customers nav button is visible in the admin menu.
topics.when: An admin clicks the Customers entry from the icon menu.
topics.then: The customerPanel accordion expands, the Customers nav tile shows aria-current="page", and Manage Books is deactivated while existing form state stays intact.
topics.notes: Focus/keyboard semantics remain a backlog item; this topic is scoped to mouse/visual parity and basic nav affordances.

topics.title: Hash & Section Deep Links
topics.goal: Guarantee every nav target (manageBooks, bundles, recordSale, bookRequests, suppliers, customers) has canonical hash and ?section alias support so admins can bookmark or share direct links.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin opens /admin with a fragment or section query referencing one of the supported panels.
topics.when: The workspace completes initialization and resolves the landing destination.
topics.then: The requested panel opens (accordion expanded or section unhidden), the nav button is marked active, non-target panels stay untouched unless the design requires hiding them, and window.location.hash reflects the canonical alias for that panel.
topics.notes: Document the supported aliases (e.g., #customers, #customer-master) and add tests to prevent regressions when new panels are added.

topics.title: Remove Nav Detail Summaries
topics.goal: Simplify the icon menu by removing the detail summary/CTA sections so each tile just routes directly to its panel.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The admin nav currently renders a detail section (`#navDetail-*`) for each tile.
topics.when: The nav initializes.
topics.then: Those detail sections no longer render (or are hidden), leaving only the primary nav buttons that route on click; no redundant summary text or CTAs are shown for any panel.
topics.notes: Update specs/tests that referenced the detail summaries/CTA buttons to reflect the leaner menu.

features.description: Introduce a dropdown sub menu under Manage Books so Add/Available/Sold act like independent pages with hash-aware routing and a consistent default state.

topics.title: Manage Sub Nav Shell
topics.goal: Render the Manage Books sub nav with Add, Available, and Sold buttons plus ARIA/hash wiring so each panel can be addressed independently.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: An admin signs in and the Manage Books tile is the landing state (#add-book).
topics.when: The Manage Books view renders.
topics.then: A sub navigation (`#manageSubNav`) appears with Add/Available/Sold buttons, Add owns aria-current/aria-controls, and the framework exposes data-manage-tab hooks reused by later topics.
topics.notes: Establishes markup, styles, and helper wiring for sub-nav dropdowns so additional Manage tabs can plug in without duplicating logic.

topics.title: Add Tab Default State
topics.goal: Keep the Add Book workflow as the default Manage view and ensure returning to Manage resets hashes/visibility to Add.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The admin either lands on /admin or returns to Manage Books after visiting another nav tile.
topics.when: The Manage tile activates or the Add tab is clicked.
topics.then: Only the Add Book panel remains visible, Available/Sold stay hidden, the Add sub tab owns aria-current, and window.location.hash normalizes to #add-book.
topics.notes: Resets any pending Manage sub-tab state whenever the user exits/enters Manage so Add is predictably first.

topics.title: Available Tab Behavior
topics.goal: Show the Available inventory list as its own Manage sub page while keeping filters and hashes consistent across tab switches.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The Manage sub nav is visible and the Available view already has search/filter state.
topics.when: The admin selects the Available sub tab or loads /admin with #manage-books/available.
topics.then: Add/Sold panels hide, the Available panel is visible/focused, window.location.hash stays #manage-books/available, and its search/filter inputs retain their last values when leaving and returning.
topics.notes: Covers aria-current swaps, hash rewrites, and state preservation for search inputs and results.

topics.title: Sold Tab Behavior
topics.goal: Expose the Sold/out-of-stock list as a dedicated Manage sub page with deep-link support and default-reset rules.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The Manage sub nav is available.
topics.when: The admin selects the Sold tab or lands on /admin#manage-books/sold and later navigates away/back to Manage.
topics.then: Only the Sold panel displays while selected, window.location.hash remains #manage-books/sold, and re-entering Manage Books restores the Add tab with hash #add-book.
topics.notes: Ensures Sold toggles open its <details>, hides Add/Available, and participates in the same routing helpers as other tabs.

features.description: Apply the existing Manage Books dropdown framework to the Bundles and Sale tiles so they share the same helper-driven UX without duplicating markup or logic.

topics.title: Bundles Sub Nav Parity
topics.goal: Rename "Create bundles" to "Bundles" and attach a two-button sub nav (Create/Manage) that reuses the Manage Books dropdown helpers, hashes, and aria wiring.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The admin nav config loads (with Manage sub nav helpers already available).
topics.when: The Bundles tile becomes active via landing state or user click.
topics.then: The tile label reads Bundles, the shared dropdown renders Create and Manage options, Create owns aria-current by default, window.location.hash reflects #bundles/create or #bundles/manage, and both buttons point to the existing panels without forking markup or JS.
topics.notes: Explicitly reuse the Manage sub nav helper/config; do not duplicate DOM fragments or routing logic when wiring Bundles.

topics.title: Sale Sub Nav Shell
topics.goal: Rename "Record sale" to "Sale" and reuse the dropdown helper to add a sub nav container (Record option for now) so future sale workflows can plug in without new plumbing.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: The nav renders after sign-in and the Manage sub nav helper is registered.
topics.when: The Sale tile activates directly or via #sale/record.
topics.then: A Sale dropdown appears (styled identically to Manage/Bundles), Record is selected by default with aria-current, the Record sale panel is the only visible section, hashes normalize to #sale/record, and no duplicate event handlers/styles are introduced.
topics.notes: Keep the helper config-driven so adding future Sale sub options (History, Returns) is purely data changes; reuse the Manage Books dropdown CSS/JS.

features.description: Future accessibility work that remains after the mouse-first Admin entry-point changes.

topics.title: Accessible Customers Entry
topics.goal: Deliver keyboard and screen-reader parity for the Customers nav flow, including focus management and deep-link announcements.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A keyboard or assistive-technology user activates the Customers nav button or loads /admin with #customers or ?section=customers.
topics.when: Navigation switches to the Customers section.
topics.then: Focus moves to the Customer panel heading/summary, ARIA relationships announce the state change, and deep links normalize to #customers without collapsing other panels.
topics.notes: Reintroduces the focus/ARIA requirements that were deferred from F15-TP2 once mouse parity shipped.

features.description: Known gaps/bugs to be resolved in later iterations.

topics.title: Sync Admin Nav With Hash History
topics.goal: Ensure browser back/forward (hashchange) keeps the nav buttons and panels aligned with window.location.hash.
topics.environment: HTML + Vanilla JavaScript + Firebase + Jest + jsdom
topics.given: A user navigates between admin sections, creating history entries (#customers, #bundles, etc.).
topics.when: They press the browser back/forward buttons and the hash changes.
topics.then: handleAdminNav (or equivalent) reruns so aria-current/panels match the hash; the UI never shows a different panel than the URL.
topics.notes: Bug report: P1 Badge Keep admin nav in sync with hash history.
